DataElement.preferredName: DWI MRI Apparent Diffusion Coefficient (ADC) Change Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Group or classification to represent a measurement of the magnitude of diffusion of water molecules within tissue using a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diffusion Weighted Imaging Apparent Diffusion Coefficient Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence._A measurement of the magnitude of diffusion of water molecules within tissue._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence.

Concepts.definition: A diffusion MRI technique in which diffusion-sensitizing gradients are applied to the imaging sequence.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measurement of the magnitude of diffusion of water molecules within tissue.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/18/14 created for C3D (Dr. Pinto) PI-RADS Protocol 14C0112. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

Concepts.definition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: A process of becoming larger, more numerous, more important, or more likely.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
